nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## Send email via Gmail on workflow error (execution and trigger-level errors)

This error handling workflow sends an email via Gmail on workflow errors with details.

It extends {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} by adding functionality covering also trigger-level errors.


---

### Features
- Get notifications on both main workflow trigger and execution time errors.
- Subject line will have the failed workflow id, name, error source (execution or trigger), error message.
- Body will contain links to both failed and error handling workflows as well as execution or trigger error details.
- Body will also contain a machine readable and enriched JSON from **`Error Trigger`** describing the error.

Use this **error handling workflow** for as many workflows as you wish.


---

### Configiration
- Copy this workflow to your workspace and, optionally, move it under the project that contains your main workflow
- In this **error handling workflow** settings, set **This workflow can be called by** as appropriate
- In **`Config`** node, define your app url, notifications recipient email, and sender name (useful to build filters in your inbox)
- In **`Gmail`** node, create and select **credentials**
- In your **main workflow** settings, pick this error handling workflow in the **Error Workflow** field ([How to...]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}


---

### Related resources
- [n8n Error Trigger]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} documentation.


---

### Author
- Reach out [Olek]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} on community.n8n.io
- [Olek]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} on n8n creators hub

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# CV Evaluation - Error Handling

## Overview
Automated workflow: CV Evaluation - Error Handling. This workflow integrates 8 different services: stickyNote, code, merge, errorTrigger, set. It contains 13 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 13
- **Node Types**: 8
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Error Trigger**: errorTrigger
- **Gmail**: gmail
- **Merge**: merge
- **Config**: set
- **Constants**: set
- **If Node**: if
- **HTML for Execution Error**: html
- **HTML for Trigger Error**: html
- **KeepEitherOfHTMLs**: merge
- **Code**: code
- ... and 3 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
